info.title: Rest API
info.description:
First you have to do login in the api to get the token an generate the session permissions. Each client has a set of permission to access to the sections in the API.
The API has several patterns to maintain the consistency.
  • The API calls for each entity will be using the entity name in plural. Example -> /api/Courses
  • When the API returns the entity in JSON it will return all its fields and the singular relations. Example -> {
         id: 1,
         user: {
             id: 5,
             username: example
         }
    }
  • To access the entity relations that are a collection, the api call will be the entity slash id slash parameter. Example -> /api/Courses/2/courseVersions

Entity List

The entities described as - means that description is not necesary
The entities are ordered alphabetically
  • Announcement: The announcement will be shown to the user when logs in or in the first entrance on the course if the announcement is course announcement
  • Classroom: The classroom is a list of users and its used to enrol all the students in a course at once
  • Company: The company is used to associate it to a platform theme, and if user belongs to company will see the platform with the style of his company theme instead platform theme. It is also used to limit the queries, for example, a user in company "A" will only see the users of company "A" and not the "B" users.
  • Course: -
  • CourseCategory: This entity is used to group the courses by category and filter
  • CourseCertificate: The course certificate is an html that student can download when the course is completed
  • CourseDescription: The course could has a list of descriptions that will be seen for the student
  • CourseDocument: -
  • CourseEnrol: The enrol of the user in a course. User can be enroled n times in each course. This entity contains information about course completition, realization days... Each enrol is associated with a CourseVersion
  • CourseGroup: To ease the Fundae bonifications you can create CourseGroups. The group has realization days and a teacher and when user is inscribed in the group it will be automatically enroled in the course
  • CourseLesson: This is a course component that can be slide show, scorm, quiz, link, survey or title. Each CourseLesson is a map between the CourseLesson and the entity (CourseQuiz, CourseSlideShow...) that stores the order. You have to create first the lesson with referenceId as null and later, for example, the quiz. The inverse association will be done automatically by the server.
  • CourseLink: Lesson type link. A link to web or document. It is always the url.
  • CourseQuiz: Lesson type quiz.
  • CourseQuizQuestionCategory: Categories for the quiz questions. They are used to configure the quiz.
  • CourseQuizQuestion: Question of the quiz. Depending the type answers will be stored in a entity or another.
  • CourseQuizQuestionDrag: In drag&drop question, there are drags and drops, it is the drag
  • CourseQuizQuestionDrop: In drag&drop question, there are drags and drops, it is the drop
  • CourseQuizQuestionOpenUserAnswer: The answer of user to open answer question
  • CourseQuizQuestionSimpleAnswer: In simple and multiple answer questions the data will be stored here.
  • CourseQuizQuestionSimpleUserAnswer: User answers of the simple answer question
  • CourseQuizQuestionUserDragOnDrop: User answers of the drag&drop question
  • CourseQuizQuestionUserWhiteAnswer: User answers of the white answer question
  • CourseQuizQuestionWhiteAnswer: White answer question. This is a sentence with blank spaces that are a dropdown. The sentence is stored in the question entity. This entity is the dropdown
  • CourseQuizQuestionWhiteAnswerOption: The different options for each WhiteAnswer entity
  • CourseQuizUserAttempt: Student can attempt the quiz a maximum number of times. Each attempt is registered here.
  • CourseScorm: Lesson type scorm
  • CourseSlideShow: Lesson type slide show
  • CourseSlideShowSlide: Each slide of the slide show
  • CourseSurvey: Lesson type survey.
  • CourseSurveyQuestion: See the CourseQuizQuestion, because its equal than this.
  • CourseSurveyQuestionOpenUserAnswer: Entity to keep yes/no, open answer, percentage and score questions
  • CourseSurveyQuestionSimpleAnswer: See the CourseQuizQuestionSimpleAnswer, because its equal than this.
  • CourseSurveyQuestionSimpleUserAnswer: See the CourseQuizQuestionSimpleUserAnswer, because its equal than this.
  • CourseUserLink: Registry about student opening links
  • CourseVersion: The courses has versions that have associated different components. Each enrol is associated to a version.
  • SecurityRole: Different roles of the user. This is used to the access permissions.
  • SecuritySection: Each section of the platform. This doesn't has crud.
  • SecurityRoleSectionPermissions: Permissions of a role in a section.
  • User: -
  • UserExtraField: To add additional fields to the user profiles
  • UserExtraFieldOption: If ExtraField is radio or checkbox, it has options.
  • UserUserExtraField: Value of the user for each ExtraField. This is the option id if is option based extra field.

Changelog 1.2

Endpoints (General)

  • Updated entities that had changes during the development.

post.summary: get token for oauth and role permissions

200.description: The credentials are ok and you can use now the token received

400.description: POST parameter missed

error_description.description: The description of the error. "POST parameter missed"

put.summary: PUT of the entity in the collection
put.description: This call adds the entity with id passed to the collection

403.description: The OAuth2 client hasn't the permissions to realize the call

422.description: The entity with the id passed in url doesn't exist or the collection entity with the id passed in url that you want to add doesn't exist

delete.summary: DELETE of the entity in the collection
delete.description: This call remove the entity of the collection

403.description: The OAuth2 client hasn't the permissions to realize the call

422.description: The entity with the id passed in url doesn't exist or the collection entity with the id passed in url that you want to remove doesn't exist

Announcement_GET.description: When course is null is because the announcement is for the entire platform.

course.description: When course is null is because the announcement is for the entire platform.

shortName.description: Required when name is bigger than 20 characters.
Required when name is bigger than 20 characters.

realizationDays.description: If null the realization days are a month by default
If null the realization days are a month by default

removeIcon.description: if this parameter is given and it's true, the course icon will be removed on PUT endpoint.

removeCatalogImage.description: if this parameter is given and it's true, the course catalogImage will be removed on PUT endpoint.

fileType.description: 1: folder. 2: image. 3: video. 4: pdf. 5: web. 6: others. It is for icon showing.
1: folder. 2: image. 3: video. 4: pdf. 5: web. 6: others. It is for icon showing.

endDate.default: now + course realization days (1 month by default)
now + course realization days (1 month by default)

course.description: in PUT endpoint the course can't be modified

user.description: in PUT endpoint the user can't be modified

type.description: 1: slideShow. 2: scorm. 3: quiz. 4: link. 5: survey. 6: title.

referenceId.description: the reference id is not required and lesson will be associated to the element on lesson especific entity creation. So first you have to create the lesson and later, for example, the quiz with this lesson.

type.description: 1: slideShow. 2: scorm. 3: quiz. 4: link. 5: survey. 6: title. In put type cannot be updated.

referenceId.description: -> the reference id is null in default and when the component (CourseSlideShow for example) is created related to this, referenceId will be automatically filled with the component id that was created.

prerequisite.description: The CourseLesson that is prerequisite to do this CourseLesson

type.description: 1: web. 2: pdf. 3: Youtube. 4: Prezi. 5: Word. 6: Excel. 7: ppt. 8: others. This is for showing the icons
1: web. 2: pdf. 3: Youtube. 4: Prezi. 5: Word. 6: Excel. 7: ppt. 8: others. This is for showing the icons

maxTime.description: time in seconds. null means unlimited
time in seconds. null means unlimited

type.description: 1: simple answer. 2: multiple answer. 3: drag&drop. 4: fill whites. 5: open answer.

extraInfo.description: used to store the sentence of white answer with this format "this is a sentence with ((1)) whites ((2))" with ((1)) and ((2)) as the codes of WhiteAnswer entity. This will be replaced with the dropdown with the options.

type.description: 1: simple answer. 2: multiple answer. 3: drag&drop. 4: fill whites. 5: open answer.

extraInfo.description: used to store the sentence of white answer with this format "this is a sentence with ((1)) whites ((2))" with ((1)) and ((2)) as the codes of WhiteAnswer entity. This will be replaced with the dropdown with the options.

file.description: Zip with the images in png and audios in the same order to link with the slide. In put it will not be taken, only in creation

image.description: The background image of the slide

audio.description: The audio to play on slide. If audio is defined, seconds will be setted as audio duration if no defined.

seconds.description: The seconds that user has to stay until go to next slide. If not defined and audio is given, it will fills with the audio duration.

video.description: The video to play on slide.

image.description: The background image of the slide

audio.description: The audio to play on slide. If audio is defined, seconds will be setted as audio duration if no defined.

seconds.description: The seconds that user has to stay until go to next slide. If not defined and audio is given, it will fills with the audio duration.

video.description: The video to play on slide.

type.description: 1: simple answer. 2: multiple answer. 3: open. 4: yes/no. 5: score.

extraInfo.description: used to store the score interface of question type score. JSON with keys scoreMax. scoreInterface.

type.description: 1: simple answer. 2: multiple answer. 3: open. 4: yes/no. 5: score.

extraInfo.description: used to store the score interface of question type score. JSON with keys scoreMax. scoreInterface.

empty.description: if this parameter is given and it's true, the new version will not be a copy of the last one on POST endpoint.

permissions.description: string with permissions. Example: rd. r: read. w: write. d: delete. R: report. a: administration
string with permissions. Example: rd. r: read. w: write. d: delete. R: report. a: administration

expirationDate.description: if expirationDate is defined the user will not be able to log in after this date. Default is none.

password.description: if password is not passed as parameter, the API will generate a random one in POST and keep the current in PUT.

expirationDate.description: if expirationDate is defined the user will not be able to log in after this date. Default is none.

removeAvatar.description: if this parameter is given and it's true, the user avatar will be removed on PUT endpoint.

notificate.description: if this parameter is given and it's true, the user will receive a welcome email.

generatePassword.description: if this parameter is given and it's true, the user password will be regenerated with a random one on PUT endpoint.

tutor.description: The user who tutors this user.

securityRoles.description: comma separated values with SecurityRole id as value or the id if only one role is needed. Example-> 1,2

items.description: json formatted key value array with variable (UserExtraField variable field) as key and value as value. Example {"var1": "myVar1", "var2": "myVar2"}

companies.description: comma separated values with Company id as value or the id if only one company is needed. Example-> 1,2
